--- title: ST4SD Services --- import { CodeSyntax } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { NetworkServices } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { CarbonForIbmDotcom } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { Kubernetes } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { AppDeveloper } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { AcceleratedComputing } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { Construct } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { ServerOperatingSystems } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; import { NaturalLanguageUnderstanding } from '@carbon/pictograms-react'; **ST4SD Services** provides capabilities for creating and controlling virtual experiments via a RESTapi and for capturing and storing the resulting data. It is built on enterprise-grade database and industry-standard RESTapi technology. Any researcher comfortable with programming can start using ST4SD Services. ## Why ST4SD Services ?
}> Create, run, and monitor the progress of, experiments from e.g. Jupyter Notebooks using our python or REST APIs. }> Our python Datastore API enables executing powerful queries over 1000s of virtual-experiment executions and retrieving any data produced by them. }> ST4SD Services enables reusing results of previous calculations rather than executing them again, a feature called Memoization This can significantly improve the execution time of your experiments.
## Try it yourself If you have access to an ST4SD Cloud instance `pip install "st4sd-runtime-core[develop]">=2.4.0` then execute: ```bash git clone https://github.com/st4sd/st4sd-examples/ cd st4sd-examples jupyter-notebook main/ST4SD\ Runtime\ API\ Example.ipynb ``` Follow the notebooks instructions to access your `ST4SD Cloud` instance and try the APIs. Also try the `ST4SD\ Datastore\ Common\ Query\ Examples.ipynb` notebook in the same folder for examples of retrieving the metadata, files, and logs that experiments generate. ## Learn More
}> [Learn](/running-workflows-on-openshift) how to use the ST4SD python client API to run, query, and interact with virtual experiments. The APIs also offer access to a trove of experiment metadata and files such as logs and outputs. You can find more examples in our Jupyter Notebooks [example repository](https://github.com/st4sd/st4sd-examples). }> Virtual Experiments may optionally implement an [interface](/writing-a-virtual-experiment-interface) to record the measurements that the experiment generates for the inputs it processes. Learn how to use virtual experiment interfaces [here](/using-a-virtual-experiment-interface). }> Switching on the [memoization feature](/memoization) configures your experiments to automatically reuse results of previous calculations rather than executing them again.
## Accelerate your simulation research with ST4SD Check out these other ST4SD technologies. All are designed to work together to provide a powerful platform for simulation.
}> **ST4SD Core** provides tools for writing virtual experiments that can run on your laptop, on HPC machines, or on cloud. [Get Started](/st4sd-core-getting-started) }> **ST4SD Cloud** creates and maintains, secure, scalable and robust deployments of ST4SD on OpenShift clusters. [Get Started](/st4sd-cloud-getting-started) }> **ST4SD Registry** provides a UI for sharing and browsing virtual experiments. [Get Started](/st4sd-registry-getting-started)
